concurrency.control

Class ConcurrencyController<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • concurrency.control.ConcurrencyController<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - the type of data items
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Strict2PLConcurrencyController, TimestampConcurrencyController

    public class ConcurrencyController<V>
extends java.lang.Object
    A ConcurrencyController controls concurrent execution of Transactions in a manner that achieves conflict-serializability.
    Author:
    Jeong-Hyon Hwang (jhh@cs.albany.edu)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ConcurrencyController.AbortException
      An AbortException is thrown if a Transaction needs to be aborted.
      static class  ConcurrencyController.InvalidTransactionIDException
      An InvalidTransactionIDException is thrown if an invalid Transaction ID is given to a ConcurrencyController.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConcurrencyController(StorageManager<V> storageManager)
      Constructs a ConcurrencyController.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void commit(int tID)
      Commits the specified Transaction.
      V read(int tID, int dID)
      Handles a read request.
      void register(int tID)
      Registers a Transaction.
      void rollback(int tID)
      Rolls back the specified Transaction.
      void write(int tID, int dID, V dValue)
      Handles a write request.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConcurrencyController

        public ConcurrencyController(StorageManager<V> storageManager)
        Constructs a ConcurrencyController.
        Parameters:
        storageManager - a StorageManager

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public void register(int tID)
        Registers a Transaction.
        Parameters:
        tID - the ID of the Transaction

      • read

        public V read(int tID,
              int dID)
       throws ConcurrencyController.InvalidTransactionIDException,
              ConcurrencyController.AbortException
        Handles a read request.
        Parameters:
        tID - the ID of the Transaction that has made the request
        dID - the ID of the data item for which the request was made
        Throws:
        ConcurrencyController.InvalidTransactionIDException - if an invalid Transaction ID is given
        ConcurrencyController.AbortException - if the request cannot be permitted and thus the related Transaction must be aborted

      • write

        public void write(int tID,
                  int dID,
                  V dValue)
           throws ConcurrencyController.InvalidTransactionIDException,
                  ConcurrencyController.AbortException
        Handles a write request.
        Parameters:
        tID - the ID of the Transaction that has made the request
        dID - the ID of the data item for which the request was made
        dValue - the value of the data item for which the request was made
        Throws:
        ConcurrencyController.InvalidTransactionIDException - if an invalid Transaction ID is given
        ConcurrencyController.AbortException - if the request cannot be permitted and thus the related Transaction must be aborted

      • rollback

        public void rollback(int tID)
        Rolls back the specified Transaction.
        Parameters:
        tID - the ID of the Transaction to roll back.

      • commit

        public void commit(int tID)
        Commits the specified Transaction.
        Parameters:
        tID - the ID of the Transaction to commit.
